channel.title: Decimal/negative numbers?
channel.description: I need to multiply a "k rate integer" (varying from 0 to 10000) by 0.0002 and then subtract 1. I will need decimal numbers for the multiplication and the result will be with decimal numbers too (half of them will be negative) All possible results will be from -1 to 1 with decimals. Is this possible in Axoloti? Sorry if this is dam question but a didn't found how...

item.title: Decimal/negative numbers?
item.dc:creator: @Diego Diego de Leon
item.description:
@Diego wrote:

you are right...
I think I will try to translate in other way. Just love the sound the most of all I try.
I did Shepard tones in other ways (even with the modular) but this concrete patch is very flexible and dynamic because anything in relative.

Read full topic

item.title: Decimal/negative numbers?
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

You seem to be trying to translate a pd patch 1:1, that is not the right approach. Your question about Shepard tone generation is far more relevant.

Read full topic

I need to multiply a "k rate integer" (varying from 0 to 10000) by 0.0002 and then subtract 1.
I will need decimal numbers for the multiplication and the result will be with decimal numbers too (half of them will be negative) All possible results will be from -1 to 1 with decimals.
Is this possible in Axoloti?
Sorry if this is dam question but a didn't found how...
